name: TableAdminClient
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
TableAdminClient
description:
TableAdminClient

Table admin operation client for create,delete table, list tables, drop row range and add/update/delete column families.

params.name: table
params.description:
The Table to create. Valid fields are name, timestamp granularity,
column families

params.name: initial_splits
params.description:
List of row keys that will be used to initially split the
table into several tablets. (tablets are similar to HBase regions)

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

client = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new(
  client_type: :table,
  instance_id: "instance-id"
)

client.table("table-1")

# Using view type
client.table("table-1", view :SCHEMA_VIEW)

params.name: view
params.description:
The view to be applied to the returned table’s fields.
Defaults to +SCHEMA_VIEW+ if unspecified.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

client = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new(
  client_type: :table,
  instance_id: "instance-id"
)

tables = client.tables

# Using view type
tables = client.tables(view :FULL)

params.name: view
params.description:
The view to be applied to the returned table’s fields.
Defaults to +SCHEMA_VIEW+ if unspecified.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Bigtable::Admin::V2::Table instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

client = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new(
  client_type: :table,
  instance_id: "instance-id"
)

client.delete_table("table-1")

params.name: modifications
params.description:
Modifications to be atomically applied to the specified table’s families
Entries are applied in order, meaning that earlier modifications can be
masked by later ones.

methods.name: drop_row_range
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
TableAdminClient#drop_row_range
methods.description: Drop row range Permanently drop/delete a row range from a specified table. The request can specify whether to delete all rows in a table, or only those that match a particular prefix.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

client = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new(
  client_type: :table,
  instance_id: "instance-id"
)

client.drop_row_range("table-1", row_key_prefix: "user")

# Delete all data
client.drop_row_range("table-1", delete_all_data_from_table: true)

params.name: row_key_prefix
params.description:
Delete all rows that start with this row key prefix. Prefix cannot be
zero length.

params.name: delete_all_data_from_table
params.description: Delete all rows in the table. Setting this to false is a no-op.
